title: Explain: Name Binding vs Assignment
story: The Python Council asks you to teach newcomers about the true nature of assignment. Your explanation will be judged by the elders for clarity and accuracy.
instructions: In 3-5 sentences, explain what Python assignment does (binding names to objects) and how this relates to mutability. Include at least one concrete example contrasting rebinding vs mutation.

explainRubric.description: Mentions that assignment binds a name to an object
Mentions immutability (strings, ints) vs mutability (lists, dicts)

hints.text: Start by explaining that Python names are labels attached to objects, not boxes that contain values.
Contrast `x = x + 1` (rebinding x to a new int) with `lst.append(1)` (mutating the list object).
Mention that immutable types (int, str, tuple) require rebinding to 'change', while mutable types (list, dict) can be modified in place.
